title: Saving lots of money!
text: I‚Äôve used it 3 times already, and I‚Äôve been very pleased. 1st time I paid $5.99 and got 6 medium sized pigs-in-a-blanket and two larger ones! Excellent value. I froze them. 2nd time I got Snap Kitchen which is ready made meals that are out of my price range usually, but I got 8 meals for $10. Unbelievable deal. Tonight I paid $10 again, this time at Whole Foods and got chicken enchiladas, salads and maple sweet potatoes. I will use it next time to get donuts for my coworkers (I will tell my coworkers they‚Äôre a day old).

title: Great app but one major flaw
text: This app is a really amazing idea however, not only is there no written review section so we can at least get an IDEA of what we could potentially good (I know it‚Äôs a surprise bag, but would be nice to have a ballpark idea from others) but they manipulate the ratings.. for instance, every resultant is like 90% liked this place. Meanwhile, for the bad ones it says ‚Äú90% gave 3 stars or more‚Äù and for the good ones ‚Äú90% gave 4 stars or more‚Äù like seriously in what world is three stars/five a positive review?! I do not like how non transparent this is. Please fix this or atleast be more honest about the ratings or provide a breakdown of how many stars and reviews each place has gotten.

title: Paid and got nothing. Waste of time.
text: First experience with this app: they take my money and I didn‚Äôt get any food. I placed an order and when I arrived, the person in charge said that he didn‚Äôt have an order from me in the app. They had 1 surprise bag that was already purchased and picked up. He showed me his phone and low and behold, my order didn‚Äôt even show up in his app even though it was confirmed in mine. Why would your app say that there were 5+ surprise bags left when there was only actually one available for the day (and already purchased)? I paid for something that didn‚Äôt even exist. Yes, the app said it was going to give me a refund, but I drove all the way there to find nothing. Waste of time.

title: Be a part of the food waste solution
text:
First, this app explains itself very well. No need to repeat it. It‚Äôs one of the best apps I‚Äôve ever seen. It‚Äôs very easy to use & gives clear instructions every step of the way. They‚Äôve thought of everything. I ordered & paid for my bag. Told it to remind me & when it was time to go, got the directions.

Second, you get a LOT of food for the $. It‚Äôs a surprise what you‚Äôll get, but a nice surprise. $15 in total for 3 places = 12 breakfasts, 6 lunches, & 4 dinners for us. I wish I could show you the pictures! This was all food that was made that day. The guy ahead of me paid $22 for a Sicilian pizza. Through this app I got an assortment of Sicilian pizza slices equaling a whole one for $6!

Most importantly, the restaurants didn‚Äôt have to throw away the food. 

Try it out, encourage your favorite food places to participate & reduce food waste!

title: Food is amazing, Prices are incredible
text: I love this app, if youre not a snobby person who expects only perfect food then you will 100% enjoy toogoodtogo. I have enjoyed everything I got because I was genuinely hungry and needed a cheap meal everytime, thank you so much. I just have one request, It would be AMAZING if the app creators could add a separate tab to favorites where you can pin stores you‚Äôre waiting for, so theyre all right there when theyre ready! That would be amazing and so convenient to have!

title: Portion size in relation to price savings
text:
I am very interested in the cause of avoiding waste so I am really interested in supporting this. And it‚Äôs great to get food at a less expensive price. But it‚Äôs not really accurate when The website puts the crossed out price as though you‚Äôre getting that much food‚Äôs worth when The portion size given out is by design less than that much money would actually pay for, at least at each of the three places I‚Äôve been to.

Not that important but I just thought I‚Äôd mention it.
It‚Äôs a great program and I‚Äôm really excited about it overall.

title: Love the app would love some updates
text:
I love the app and use it a lot for quick cheap food since I work long hours and don‚Äôt have time to dedicate to thinking about my meals. 

That being said I‚Äôd love an easy add to calendar feature to further help with my hectic schedule; the app reminders are often too far out to be effective and I really like having all my tasks easy in my schedule. Please please please this feature would save me from missing so many pickups because I simply don't have the time/capacity to manually enter everything

title: Dumpster diving but more expensive
text: I picked up a bag of produce from Manalo market in San Diego and everything was rotten. The avocado, the pear, the citrus, the lettuce, even the pineapple when you cut it open was moldy soft, rotten. Maybe if you stick with donuts and cookies from other venders  it‚Äôs OK? If this review allowed you to send pictures I could post images. I got a hot meal as well. Basically it was a day old chicken which theoretically could be cut up and used in chicken salad so I can‚Äôt complain about that and then I got a really disgusting small tub of some kind of pork rinds and maybe that‚Äôs an acquired taste so I‚Äôm just putting it out there that it wasn‚Äôt edible. At least for me. I could go to McDonald‚Äôs for $6 and get a better deal and that‚Äôs not saying much ):

title: Literally just trash no one wants
text: This seemed like a marvelous idea for so many reasons. It‚Äôs disappointing it‚Äôs just a money grab from businesses to scrape the barrel literally and serve you a chum bucket slurry of inedible mess. The video ad was extremely misleading with nicely wrapped, presentable meals were shown, and ‚Äúnever any duplicates‚Äù were lied to me. I tried several different stores through this app hoping it was just a single bad experience. I‚Äôd rather actually be able to consume what I‚Äôm purchasing than drive out of my way somewhere I would never go so far for, waste money at the register, and just throw it away and have to buy something else that‚Äôs edible. I don‚Äôt care if I supposedly saved 77lbs of emissions, I‚Äôm still starving!

title: Love This and Need More!
text:
Love that there is an app to give people away to buy some good, discounted food that may otherwise be trashed at the end of the day! I hope more restaurants and stores hear about this because it‚Äôs fun to see what you might get! I would love for there to be more lunch / dinner type places, and I keep hoping a place with cookies will show up on here since we love cookies in our house! 

Only wish I could get notifications of when my favorites post something to be able to purchase. I check the app often.

title: Great deal on left over pastries!
text:
This was my first time to use this app and service and was I impressed! For less than $5 I was able to take home 4 pastries of my choosing at Peet‚Äôs coffee house! They have better pastries than Starbucks to begin with! The pastries might be almost but not quite a day old but who cares? They‚Äôre still good for late night coffees/snack.
Thanks so much,Pete‚Äôs Coffee, for letting people like me enjoy your left over for the day pastries instead of throwing them away! Much appreciated!

title: Awesome but locations off
text: Such a great app! So many people use it so you do have to be on your game to grab a bag before they run out. Only complaint is every time I click location in app for directions, they‚Äôve been wrong. Since I live in a city with no good parking, this has been frustrating! It often just leads me to the street name but sometimes 5 blocks away. So just to note that you should always look up the store in your own maps and not from the app!

title: Interesting concept, but..
text:
‚Ä¶this app is begging for a couple simple changes that would make a vast improvement in the user experience! When saving a store to our favorites, we should get a push notification when these stores make new items available. 
Also, instead of a radius, I‚Äôd love to be able to draw on the map to include areas that I‚Äôd like to search in. In L.A., it doesn‚Äôt make sense for me to have stores that are west of me included in the search. These updates would make the app much more functional!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Can‚Äôt believe I‚Äôm only trying this now. Where has this been my whole life??!! As a person who loves trying new things, frugal shopping, and reducing waste this app checks all the boxes ^[^. Only wish more restaurants and bakeries in my area participated in this initiative‚Äî I‚Äôm thinking of advertising for TGTG for myself, the community, and the sellers- it‚Äôs uniquely a win-win-win for all involved and I plan to use this app v frequently! Recommending it to everyone I know. Couldn‚Äôt rave about this more hahaha

title: Misleading marketing
text: I was a big fan of foodforall and thought this app would be similar. It must be the way this app markets itself to restaurants, because the places I‚Äôve tried gave an extremely small amount of food despite being labeled as a meal, and made me feel like an inconvenience and a charity for using the app. I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm fighting food waste. It is not comparable to a normal order from the same restaurant. Also no way to choose dietary restrictions, we received meals we could not eat. The developer needs to better communicate their expectations to the businesses or they are simply misleading users. User reviews of restaurants should be publicly visible.

title: Good concept, terrible implementation
text: I have tried this service three time and had a bad experience each time. I‚Äôm done. First time received food that was nothing like what is on the menu. Rice and beans from an Italian restaurant? The next two times when I got to the restaurant I was told they don‚Äôt participate any longer and didn‚Äôt give me food. Both restaurants said they had contacted the company a week ago without a response. Wasted time and expense to travel to a restaurant for nothing, and then I have to come up with a new dinner plan late at night. I‚Äôm certainly not going to spend money at the restaurant where I got screwed over. I wish this worked because I like the concept, but three strikes and I‚Äôm done.

title: Great app, hit or miss vendors.
text:
I feel like the app works great and allows you to reserve orders easily. The only problem is the vendors. Some seem like they are using this as some kind of new Groupon to get people to try their stores and it‚Äôs not really being used to offload product that would be thrown away otherwise. 

Other vendors are great, usually bakers who toss stuff at the end of the day due to staleness. I‚Äôd recommend looking at the reviews on the app and not the reviews for the vendors off of google. Anything below 4 stars on the app should be avoided.

title: Inexpensive Way to Explore and Get Food
text: Honestly a great way to save money and explore the neighborhood that you‚Äôre in. There were many times in which I wasn‚Äôt sure whether or not the walk to a store I‚Äôve never been to would be worth it, but was pleasantly surprised that it was. The food is usually a lot more than what you would normally pay for, and is shareable with friends. And at the same time, you‚Äôre contributing to the fight in food waste which is a plus.

title: Game changer!
text:
To all the reviewers whining about not being able to choose food sensitivities, allergies, etc‚Ä¶ just pay full price for your food if you want to be picky. Also, restaurant owners are people! Just talk to them and ask, and if it turns out you can‚Äôt eat the plate you just received, pay it forward and give it to someone else or a homeless person.

This is surplus, mystery food meant to reduce food waste and benefit society and the planet as a whole, not your personal discount Yelp.

title: Great idea but bad execution
text:
I am all for reduce/reuse/recycle and really tried to love this idea, but I think half of the people/businesses who sign up for this deal don‚Äôt even know how it suppose to work. 

And it‚Äôs coming from a person who can eat anything and cook something up from whatever. 

I‚Äôve gotten stale bagels, dried out pastry, moldy fruits, badly bruised up/leaky fruits. Sour meats and salads. I would walk into some of the stores for people to yell at me because I didn‚Äôt call the store to find out if they had anything available (I guess they didn‚Äôt understand why they have to indicate the number of bags available). I would hear that they run out of bags, that I came too late (even if it was within the apps time range) or too early. 

Yes, I also have gotten decent pastry and fruits but the quality of those was the price paid. Not the 1/3rd of the price as advertised. 

You need to train people you sign up better, then this app will become priceless.

title: Lots of options in Austin, TX
text: Love this app! Have used it 3 times now and have been pleasantly surprised each time. I get lots of food for the low. As a single person I can usually eat 2-3 meals on 1 surprise bag that costs $5.99 - $9.99. I even got an ingredients bag for $3.99 and was able to make deli style sandwiches (turkey, salami & roast beef with hoagie roll pieces) for a week! Excellent value and fun to ‚Äúsurprise‚Äù yourself if you‚Äôre not a picky eater. I wish the options were better in San Antonio, TX. More businesses should do this!

title: GREAT CONCEPT, NEED EXPANSION
text:
I LOVE the concept of this app, and I fully support the cause as well. As a person who has worked good service many times, I see a lot of food that could be used for people in need, but that gets thrown out.

I would love this app to expand it‚Äôs supported/partners restaurants! I live in Washington State, and it doesn‚Äôt seem like there‚Äôs any supported restaurants here. 

Would love to see this grow more onto the west coast! I‚Äôd reccomend einstien Bros bagels as a place to partner with, as they always have good food that‚Äôs wasted from left over throughout the day.

title: Brilliant concept
text: A friend put me onto this app and I can‚Äôt stop using it. Even if I‚Äôm not hungry or interested in a purchase, I look to see what‚Äôs available in any area I‚Äôm in. Many businesses like bakeries, bagel shops and fast food restaurants waste an awful lot of food simply because it wasn‚Äôt sold in time. This app has also enabled me to eat out when my budget is tight and it generates business for those who participate. Take today for instance, Kim‚Äôs is going to be my new Fish Market.

title: Great concept
text: I've been working in the hospitality/food industry for years and it always saddened me watching how much food was thrown away at the end of the night. Usually enough to feed well over 5-10 people easily. Everything from banquets, buffets, plated meals, etc. I'm glad somebody created something like this. Just used for the first time and when you're indecisive and running low on time this is great. Haven't tried it with groceries yet but I'm sure I will.

title: Great find!
text: Nothing better than a good deal while preventing food waste! I‚Äôm in the SFV of Los Angeles and within a mile there‚Äôs at least three locations that have multiple pickups daily. I‚Äôve not found another app that has as much community participation as this one and I love it. You prepay for a pickup, my offers are always a day in advance, and then just tell them you‚Äôre picking up a Too Good to Go order and you‚Äôll get some quality items for really cheap!

title: Good concept bar service
text:
While the concept of this app is a great idea to deal with the food waste it needs improvement. We should be able to see written reviews of other costumers. Also, not because you are paying 5$ it means that they can give a bunch of bagels that are hard as a stone and the same with a croissant. It looks like they have kept this food forever in their refrigerator and then they just give it to you. You could get a small frozen pizza at the supermarket for 5$ or similar and then cook it at home. The food just looks too old and bad and when you contact costumer service they just tell you that you can put it in the oven and eat it.

Not worth it.

title: Want to see more information on customer reviews and stores to offer more
text: I wish there was more info about customer reviews, we only can see a star rating from 1-5. It‚Äôs hard to know what to expect in your package. So many of my pickups contain 3 small items and it‚Äôs not worth my time to go back to those places. It feels more like store is making some extra easy cash then actually giving food that could‚Äôve been wasted to a customer willing to go out of their way to get it. It would be nice to have more info about what to expect and also stores should be encouraged to make it worth the customers time.

title: App is for a good cause but it is not worth in Vancouver Canada
text:
I really love the idea but in Vancouver Canada the app is not up to my expectations. My 1star is for 2reason:
1. The value which is shown in the app like 21 dollars worth of good for 6.99, the restaurant does not give that. I get what i pay for. If I ask the store about the value they get all upset about it saying that‚Äôs not how it works. So basically I can buy it from store without using the app. There is no surplus. This seems very sketchy. 

2. Recently  I got 5 of my products from a store expired the value shown was 21 which I bought for 6.99. During my purchase I was was not told that I would get expired goods. Some had expired 6 months back. When I reached out asking for value of 21 since it will definitely not 6.99. TGTG did not refund my money they gave me a voucher. So basically now my money is stuck. Expired goods are not surplus they are bad sale strategy by the store. TGTG should not promote this. In Canada it is legal but then discouraged. 

NEVER using this again for using and wasting my hard earned money.

title: Great Idea!
text: I really love this concept and can‚Äôt believe I didn‚Äôt know about this app until now. My one issue is that either the notifications aren‚Äôt working well, or people are snatching up the bags so quickly that there isn‚Äôt even any time to send out notifications. If that‚Äôs the case, could there be a cap of how many grab bags you are allowed to get within a certain amount of time? I only ever see about 3-4 of the same restaurants no matter what day or time of day it is. It always says ‚Äúyou just missed it‚Äù.

title: Wouldnt close our store
text:
Hi!
We have had some very large issues;
First; any day we didnt have leftover food, they would still allow people to order from us and we would have to turn them away, even though we would mark on the app that we had no items.
Second; we closed since my boss retired. We talked on the phone and email multiple times telling them we were closing and to take down our store and they said they would, but we still got orders days later when we were closed.
Third; we had many orders that we filled in December yet they are pretending we havent gotten any December orders. Where is my boss‚Äôs money? She needs that, shes elderly and her husband is sick.
Last; trying to contact them is almost impossible at least on the business end; they have a live chat and phone number, which rarely have people on them to respond (not even a voicemail). Or you can fill out a form for them to email you back. 
Its a good idea but id much rather see the food going to homeless or lower class families that need it too.

title: Needs to update their stores
text: Ordered from juicy Lucy at amboy rd , when we got there the store was completely closed light were all off and a sign said they moved to 20-1 Jefferson Blvd, we drive there and no sign of them as well. No number or email to contact too good to go!? Not right to charge people and the place is not even open or moved! Please fix this issue. Should only charge people when they are there to pick up the items!

title: Good concept, good experience overall
text:
Who doesn‚Äôt like saving on fast food? Will it be fresh? No! But you didn‚Äôt care about it in the first place! You want to scarf down a bagel, a cookie, and pizza while saving some dough! 

The only drawback is that it‚Äôs a crap shoot. Sometimes you‚Äôre lucky, sometimes you‚Äôre not. It‚Äôs the nature of the beast. You can always pay full price for what you truly want. For us price-conscious people, this is a great way to spend our money.

title: Hit or Miss
text:
I guess from the great photography from using the app, led my expectations to be high. My first experience wasn‚Äôt so great, but then the second one was a little better.  So I rate this app high because we have to remind ourselves the purpose of this app is avoiding food waste. I feel if the more in demand of participants, the better turn out in products.

üôèüíÜ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èI also gave away some products to people who would enjoy cereal or treats that doesn‚Äôt work in my diet.

title: Fun Food Adventure
text:
We tried the app for the first time today. It led us to two neighborhood groceries we had never been to before. Both were unique groceries with delicious food. We‚Äôd visit both again. 

In both locations the staff was familiar with the app and the surprise bag concept so  it was a very comfortable and easy process. 

At the first location we received a delightful selection of delicious food. At the second location we received a selection of sugary, packaged sweets and pastries. This was less desirable, but still a fun experience. We also bought several additional grocery items at both locations. 

It was a fun, culinary experience that took us out of our routine food buying experiences. The next time, we‚Äôre going to challenge ourselves by making a dinner using the surprise bags!

title: To good to go
text: Is one of my favorite treats every week. It‚Äôs a way to pick up delicious food and save it from being discarded by the shop because it will become too stale to sell. I save several of my favorite bakeries and check if the have a goody bag for pickup that includes 3 different treats, which most of the time, costs less than one item included in your bag. You don‚Äôt know what you are going to get, but most of the time it‚Äôs a good surprise‚Ä¶

title: Be careful of the surprise bag
text: The store had description for bread and pastry, the bag I received were all donuts. If I would get a surprise bag for donuts why should I order it from a bakery store instead of a donuts store? The manager agreed to return the order but he insisted I should do it from the app. The app doesn‚Äôt offer this feature. So it was ended up more food were wasted. There is no review for each store on the app either, so there is no way for the new customer to learn the overall experience from previous customers, the overall shop score doesn‚Äôt help much.

title: Don‚Äôt get if you live in a smaller area. Totally useless.
text: I‚Äôm an still giving five stars because it is not the apps fault and I love the concept. App seemed to be built well with an intuitive UI also. However, unless you live in a massive city, this app will not work. For example, there was not one participating store in West Virginia. The closest city that had any stores was Philadelphia as not even Pittsburg had any. Not a knack on the app itself but more a notice to others.

title: One of the Best Food apps I never knew I needed!
text: So far so great!! I rarely leave app reviews but this app has already been a game changer for me and my friend. The value of the food we‚Äôre getting is incredible and it feels like a we‚Äôre taking a more ‚Äògreener‚Äô approach to take-out. Tonight‚Äôs meal was a soulful and filling Vegetarian dinner from Harlem that was just under 10 bucks - for 2 people! I hope more local restaurants near me join this app soon and can‚Äôt wait to try new spots  : )

title: Notification on order cancelled
text: Brought the surprise bag for the very first time, so I am constantly checking on the app to see if I am doing to right thing.  At pick up time, I had open the app to see it if prompt me to do anything that I need for the pick up.  Nothing was announced, until I went inside the store to get the bag, they told me the order is cancelled, there‚Äôs nothing left to be picked up.. I was like WHAT?!?  It didn‚Äôt mentioned any cancellations of the order on the app about it whatsoever.  Lucky I didn‚Äôt live far.. but it was 9:30pm (pick up time), this is so wrong!

title: Please keep making it better
text: I‚Äôm a little frustrated by the filters that are lacking.I would love to see a list of available restaurants that offer a pick up within a certain window today, in a certain geographic region. I would also like to exclude vendors that I‚Äôve used previously and didn‚Äôt like. It seems I have to wade thru a lot of crap to get that information. There are some diamonds in here, but there‚Äôs a lot more low- value offerings, like the grocers that fill up a bag with rotten food. There‚Äôs a big difference between ‚Äúpast prime‚Äú and unusable.

title: Saving food is fun and delicious.
text: Best app for saving food from being thrown in the trash.  I‚Äôve saved food from bagel shops, pizza places, various restaurants, a local organic co-op market, coffee shops, and even one of our local farms.  Highly recommend using this app.  I love that you can set favorite places to quickly see if they have anything available.  Now with more and more places popping up, I don‚Äôt have to travel too far to save good food unless I want to.

title: Wasted money‚Ä¶
text:
Terrible customer service. No real person responded to me and my follow up on the matter was ignored and instead I was asked to write a review! Well, here you go.
I placed an order DURING the pick up window, due to terrible traffic (I was just a mile away), I could not make it in time to pick up my order. The restaurant even closed at the end of the pick up window. I was told via email that I should have cancelled my order 2 hours prior to the pick up window. How!? I placed my order within the pick up window! Make this make sense. Everything is time stamped right? I used this app to save money, and it ended up being wasted. Won‚Äôt be using this anymore.

title: Fabulous app
text:
We absolutely love this app! It‚Äôs great to help our local businesses by getting them some money for delicious food they would otherwise have to toss and we get a great deal! We‚Äôve discovered new places that we never would have known about if not for this app. It‚Äôs definitely a win-win all around. 

I only hope more restaurants and grocery stores will join this movement. Any store that sells fresh food especially would benefit from this. Just about everything we‚Äôve tried we‚Äôve loved.

Can‚Äôt say enough about this app, it‚Äôs really easy to use, especially for us seniors! 

If you care about the terrible amount of wasted food, if you like getting a great discount, then this app is made for people like you! So glad I found it!! I‚Äôve been sharing it with everyone!

title: The best app I have ever used
text: This app is incredible. It‚Äôs a perfect example of what this world needs more of- businesses that look to fill gaps in demand and that can help to fight waste and improve efficiency in our society. As a young student, I‚Äôve relied on this app a lot, 20-30 times, and it has let me down maybe once. I‚Äôve recommended it to almost everyone who‚Äôs in my position. I only hope for it to keep growing and spreading to more restaurants

title: Tried to Set Expectations Low - Still Bummed
text:
I was so excited to try this app out! I made sure to read reviews and set decent expectations for myself. I know not all of the purchases are going to be the best, but I was still disappointed.

I tried a few places‚Äô mystery bags, including a smaller organic produce store (some reviews said to avoid big chains). While the store sold almost entirely produce, I didn‚Äôt get any. My bag was filled with boxes of chips and flour that was almost a year old at least and a refrigerated dip that expired months ago. 

Similar things happened for the other. I know lots of food stays good for awhile after expiration - but these were too old/stale in an unexpected way.

I‚Äôm still open to trying a few more places because it is sustainable and pretty neat, but I would love a way to review specific places (other than the quick star ratings) so people know what they‚Äôre getting into.

title: This needs to get out to more restaurants and stores!!!
text: My first one was an amazing experience! The app is super user friendly. Can‚Äôt wait to keep going with this‚Ä¶ the staff was really excited to give it and I was really happy to be taking part in the cause. Not to mention it will be a life saver with the cost of food these days and again; an great win for the planet. Doing my part one thing at a time. Will recommend to everyone!

title: Good bargains to be had
text: I‚Äôve gotten several bag from several different places. I‚Äôve gotten everything from basically a full meal to rice and potatoes (they were very good). It has been fun trying new places.  You seem to do the best with bags from bakeries:Pretty much guaranteed to be pastries. The one thing I wish is that you would get a text when a favorite vendor lists a bag. It is so frustrating to open the app and seeing that a place I‚Äôve been hoping to try sold out two hours ago.

title: More misses than hits and no customer service
text: I love the idea in theory but my experience usually ends in frustration. With the exception of one generous local business, the value of the bags rarely seems to equal the stated value (and if course, the selection may not suit your taste on top of that). Also, be aware that orders placed within 2 hours of the pick up window cannot be cancelled, even if the error is caught immediately. At this point, I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôve spent more  through this app than the value I‚Äôve received. Too good to go is too disappointing to provide an actual solution to our food waste problem.

title: When you dispute a transaction, they will block you from future ordering.
text: Why did you guys block me from using this application? I am trying to order food, but you guys declined all of my credit cards, and I am also not able to add a credit card or update my profile. I am just guessing because with my last order, I had an issue with the restaurant and was not able to get my food. I had to dispute this very bad transaction. You guys solved the problem very late, but now I am blocked from using your application. Adding a credit card future is not active in my application. It means I am blocked just because I asked for help from you. This is very rude.

title: Great concept, poor execution
text: This is a wonderful concept to fight food waste, but the restaurants on the app aren‚Äôt trustworthy enough to follow through on the promise and execution. I‚Äôve used it twice now for two different restaurants in my area: One gave me a small portion under the stated value, and the other literally tossed in $5 worth of goods in a bag, including month-expired tofu. The app doesn‚Äôt have an easy system to flag this, and instead suggests contacting customer support for every issue, which is burdensome.
